channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Maduro Faces His Ultimate Fight as Trump Threatens Military Action in Venezuela
item.description: President Trump’s threat of military action has confronted President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela with the gravest challenge of his crisis-ridden reign...

item.title: Exclusive: Billionaire Michele Kang launches $25 million U.S. Soccer institute that promises to transform the future of women’s sports
item.description: Women are not just "small men"—and Kang's efforts will target everything from treating women's injuries to preventing girls from dropping out of youth...

item.title: UN warns about AI becoming another ‘Great Divergence’ between rich and poor countries like the Industrial Revolution
item.description: “We believe we need more balance, less hysteria and hype,” said Philip Schellekens, the UNDP's chief economist for the Asia Pacific.

item.title: Ayanna Pressley Won’t Challenge Markey for Senate in Massachusetts
item.description: Ms. Pressley, a prominent progressive, will instead run for re-election to the House. Her move is expected to help Senator Ed Markey, though he still ...

item.title: Sabrina Carpenter rips ‘evil and disgusting’ White House use of one of her songs in an ICE raid video montage
item.description: "Do not ever involve me or my music to benefit your inhumane agenda.”

item.title: How Anthropic’s safety first approach won over big business—and how its own engineers are using its Claude AI
item.description: Anthropic engineers mostly use Claude for debugging, not writing new software, but they worry about deskilling

item.title: San Francisco Will Sue Ultraprocessed Food Companies
item.description: The city attorney accuses large manufacturers of causing diseases that have burdened governments with public health costs.

item.title: Reckoning With a New Era of Deadly Floods
item.description: The floods and landslides that have killed more than 1,350 people in recent weeks are a grim reminder of the risks of a warming planet.

item.title: In Photos and Video: Devastating Floods Swamp South Asia
item.description: Images of the destruction caused by storms that have torn through South and Southeast Asia.

item.title: Whoops, the New Skating Rink Is Encroaching on Luciano Pavarotti
item.description: “Nessun Dorma?” More like “Ice, Ice Baby,” as a statue in Italy is overshadowed.
